description.narrative:
Promote the development and capacity of older people associations(OPAs)
Support the rehabilitation of poor older people and their families in earthquake-affected communities in Sichuan (China) through strengthened community-based Older People’s Associations.
Advocates by disseminating good practice from older people’s associations to relevant authorities to assist them in implementing better health management services at grass-root levels, establishing an age care system, expanding aging associations and encouraging volunteerism among older people.
Work with China National Committee on Aging, based in Beijing, in a one-million dollar project with UNFPA to promote local planning for aging in 6 counties in different provinces in east, central and western regions of China.

The project is aimed at disseminating good practice from older people’s associations (OPAs) to relevant authorities to assist them in implementing better health management services at grass-root levels, establishing an age care system, expanding ageing associations and encouraging volunteerism among older people.
